data.text:
WR CONDUCTS SPECIAL SURPRISE TICKET CHECKING DRIVE OVER MUMBAI SUBURBAN LOCAL TRAINS & STATIONS

Almost Rs.6.40 lakh realized in fines from unauthorized travelling through this surprise checking drive

In order to ensure hassle-free, comfortable travel & better services to all bonafide passengers and to deter ticketless travelling, special ticket checking drives are carried out at frequent intervals over Western Railway, in addition to the regular intensive ticket checking drives, especially in the Mumbai suburban section. In this very direction, a special ticket checking drive was conducted in local trains, including AC local trains. Similarly, a surprise check known as â€˜Fortress Checkâ€™ was also conducted at Nallasopara station.

According to a press release issued by Shri Sumit Thakur â€“ Chief Public Relations Officer of Western Railway, Mumbai Central Division of WR frequently conducts ticket checking drives and also special drives with an element of surprise to nab unauthorized travellers. A special ticket checking drive was conducted by commercial officers, ticket checking & RPF staff in AC local trains as well as suburban stations from 8th to 15th June, 2023. During the check, more than 1560 cases were detected and penalty of more than Rs. 4.90 lakh were recovered from unauthorized commuters.

Shri Thakur further informed that a surprise check was also conducted at Nallasopara station o­n 15th June, 2023. For this Fortress Check, 21 Ticket Checking staff & 7 RPF personnel were deployed. During the check, 495 cases were detected and an amount of approx. Rs. 1.49 lakh was realized as fine in a single day.

Western Railway appeals all esteemed commuters to travel with a proper and valid ticket, which can be procured through the ticket booking counters or ATVM machines or can be purchased o­nline through UTS App.

*******

WESTERN RAILWAY TO EXTEND TRIP OF

BANDRA TERMINUS - GORAKHPUR SUMMER SPECIAL TRAIN

For the convenience of passengers and with a view to meet the travel demand, Western Railway has decided to extend the trip of Train No. 05054/05053 Bandra Terminus â€“ Gorakhpur Weekly Summer Special train o­n Special fare o­n existing composition, timings, stoppages, etc.

According to a press release issued by Shri Sumit Thakur â€“ Chief Public Relations Officer of Western Railway, details of the train is as under:

â—Train No. 05054/05053 Bandra Terminus â€“ Gorakhpur Weekly Summer Special

Train No. 05054 Bandra Terminus â€“ Gorakhpur Special will now have an additional trip o­n 24th June, 2023.

Similarly, Train No. 05053 Gorakhpur - Bandra Terminus Special will now have an additional trip o­n 23rd June, 2023.

The booking of extended trips of Train No. 05054 will open from 18th June, 2023 at PRS counters & o­n IRCTC website. For detailed information regarding timings of halts and composition, passengers may please visit www.enquiry.indianrail.gov.in.
